page.title: 06CANOE SLALOM
page.content: At the bridge over the Tweed two canoe slaloms are run each year. The first event is in spring when the river is still high from the winter snows. It is run by Edinburgh University Canoe Club and is Division 2 and 3 ranking. Competitors from all over Britain take part in the event. Their results are taken from this event and all the others they participate in and their standing is ranked along with all other competitors in their division throughout Britain by the British Canoe Union and the Scottish Canoe Association. The second event is run in the summer by the Selkirk High School Club who are the only Scottish school to run a National ranking event. This event is for Division 4 and Novice Paddlers.
